intro: Korthalsella australis, commonly known as the Australian korthalsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Korthalsella australis is a low-growing shrub that is well adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of its native habitat.
